On 12/8/05, Yagiz Erkan <yagizerkan@...> wrote:
> Simon,
>
> The buil=
d machines that you talk about, in a continuous integration
> environment o=
r not, pull the code to build from the source control system.
> Therefore, =
the developers need to check in the code before a build can
> happen. And a=
 developer checks in the code only if all the tests succesfully
> completes=
. Therefore, if you cannot or you don't run all your unit tests on
> your w=
orkstation, you cannot check in the code that you're working on.

I like yo=
ur view of the world, but it is at odd with the one I live
and work in. We =
have developers write code with no tests. They rarely
run what tests they d=
o have before they check in, so I suggest that
having Cruise Control run th=
e full test suites, on everything all the
time, is vital.

Simon
